md:
giải nghĩa từ "wouldn" sang tiếng việt; đưa ra nghĩa tiếng việt theo từ loại và đưa ra câu ví dụ, các từ liên quan.

1. Would ( auxiliary verb )
	* Meaning: used to express a future event that is not certain to happen.
	* Example: "I would like to go to the movies tonight." (Tôi muốn đi xem phim tối nay.)
	* Related words: will, shall, can, could, may, might.
2. Would ( conditional verb )
	* Meaning: used to express a hypothetical or uncertain situation and its consequences.
	* Example: "If I won the lottery, I would buy a house." (Nếu tôi trúng số, tôi sẽ mua một ngôi nhà.)
	* Related words: could, might, should, ought to.
3. Would ( polite expression )
	* Meaning: used to express politeness or courtesy.
	* Example: "Would you like a cup of coffee?" (Bạn có muốn một cốc cà phê không?)
	* Related words: could, might, shall, should.
4. Would ( habitual verb )
	* Meaning: used to express a habitual or repeated action in the past.
	* Example: "When I was a child, I would often go to the park." (Khi tôi còn là một đứa trẻ, tôi thường đi đến công viên.)
	* Related words: used to, was/were, did.

Note: The meaning of "would" can vary depending on the context and sentence structure.
html:
giải nghĩa từ "wouldn" sang tiếng việt; đưa ra nghĩa tiếng việt theo từ loại và đưa ra câu ví dụ, các từ liên quan.

  1. Would ( auxiliary verb )
    • Meaning: used to express a future event that is not certain to happen.
    • Example: "I would like to go to the movies tonight." (Tôi muốn đi xem phim tối nay.)
    • Related words: will, shall, can, could, may, might.
  2. Would ( conditional verb )
    • Meaning: used to express a hypothetical or uncertain situation and its consequences.
    • Example: "If I won the lottery, I would buy a house." (Nếu tôi trúng số, tôi sẽ mua một ngôi nhà.)
    • Related words: could, might, should, ought to.
  3. Would ( polite expression )
    • Meaning: used to express politeness or courtesy.
    • Example: "Would you like a cup of coffee?" (Bạn có muốn một cốc cà phê không?)
    • Related words: could, might, shall, should.
  4. Would ( habitual verb )
    • Meaning: used to express a habitual or repeated action in the past.
    • Example: "When I was a child, I would often go to the park." (Khi tôi còn là một đứa trẻ, tôi thường đi đến công viên.)
    • Related words: used to, was/were, did.

Note: The meaning of "would" can vary depending on the context and sentence structure.
